metadata.title: CVE-2023-51384 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.6, certain destination constraints can beincompletely applied. When destination constraints are specified duringaddition of PKCS#11-hosted private keys, these constraints are only appliedto the first key, even if a PKCS#11 token returns multiple keys.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51384` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-sftp-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-tests - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
ssh - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6').
openssh-ssh1 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
